_header: The right pit of hell is amid the earth within
Note: For Part I, see 4732; for Part II, see 4731.
Bibliographic Ghosts: Cambridge UK, Cambridge University Library Ff.5.48, f. 79: not in this MS; London, Lambeth Palace Library 223: not in this MS.
_description: A collection of pseudo-scientific material incorporated as Part III in the legend of St. Michael

BodDig75.First Lines:
And les yf it be a knaffe chylde for it had mare heteBot when
                    þe lymmes are fryste made þai are noȝt full
                    grete…
BodDig75.Last Lines:
…Now god tat gaffe vs saule len vs so it to rede þat
                    saint mychaell may it resawe & to blysse it lede

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
ÞE riȝte put of helleA midde eorþe is with
                    InneVr lord þat al made I wisQweynte is of
                    gynne…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Now God þat vs soule gafVs lete hire so
                    ledeÞat seint Michel hire mote a vongeAnd bi fore him lede.
                    AMEN.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodLauMis108.First Lines:
ÞE riȝte put of helle is a midde þe eorþe with
                    InneÞat ore louerd it made iwis þat quoynte was of
                    ginne…
BodLauMis108.Last Lines:
…Nov Iesu crist þat us soule ȝaf graunte us þat we
                    hire moten so here redeÞat Seint MIȝhel hire mote a fongue and bi
                    fore to Ioye lede
BodLauMis108.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl. 
             “Die Legende des heilige Michael nach MS Laud 108.” 
             Jahrbuch für romanische und englische Sprache und
                Literatur
         13 (1874): 150-80: 154-80.
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             The Early South-English Legendary.
EETS
         o.s. 87 (1887; repr. 1987): 299-322.

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
ÞE riht pit of helle is a midde þe eorþe with
                    inneOure lord þat all þing makede Queint he is of
                    gynne…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…Nou god þat vs soule ȝaf vs lete it here so
                    redeþat seint Michel mot it afonge & toforne him lede
BodLauMis463.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line.

BodLauMis685.First Lines:
The ryȝt pytt of hell ys amyd erth with ynOur lord that all
                    mad quaynt he ys of gyn…
BodLauMis685.Last Lines:
…drowd wemyd & gret drynker in wrath all most wood hardy
                    & lyȝt stabull a waker full good

CamCCC145.First Lines:
Þe riȝte put of helle is amidde eorþe wiþ
                    InneOure louerd ere al made iwis queintise of gynne…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…Nou god þat us soule ȝaf us lete hure here so
                    redeþat sein Michel is mot anonge & biuore him lede
CamCCC145.Editions:
D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.  
             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145
                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS
         o.s. 235 (1959), 236 (1956); repr. 1967: 2.402-28.

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
Þe riȝte pitt of helle is amydde þe eorþe wiþ
                    ynneOure lord þat alle þing made wiþ queyntyse of
                    gynne…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…Now god þat ȝaf vs soule vs here so wisse and
                    redeÞat Seint Michel hit mote affonge and to ioye lede
CamMagPep2344.Attributed Title:
De Puteo inferni (RT); De planetis (RT); De disposiciones hominis
                    (RT)

CamTCC605.First Lines:
þe ryȝt pute of helle is amydde þe erþe with
                    Inneoure lord þat al mad ywys queynte is of gynne…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…Now god þat ous saule ȝaf & sende ous lete oure
                    [sic] so redeþat seint mychel hem mote fange & byfor god of heuene
                    lede
CamTCC605.Note:
With I and II; no rubricated initial to indicate division between this
                    and II.
CamTCC605.Attributed Title:
De Puteo inferni (RT); De planetis (RT); De disposiciones hominis
                    (RT)
CamTCC605.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of Trinity College Cambridge MS R.3.25.
         https://mss-cat.trin.cam.ac.uk/Manuscript/R.3.25.

BLAdd10301.First Lines:
ÞE riȝte put of helle is a midde erþe wiþ
                    InneOure lorde þat al made y wis queintis of gynne…
BLAdd10301.Last Lines:
…Eues geþ heuene aboute þoru þe day & þoru
                    þe niȝte& þe mone & þe sterren wiþ hym
                    bereþ & þe sonne so briȝte…
BLAdd10301.Note: Ends imperfectly after 12 lines, rest of MS missing.

BLAdd22283.First Lines:
ÞE riht put of helleA midde eorþe is withInneVr lord
                    þat al made I wisQweynte is of ginne…
BLAdd22283.Last Lines:
…Nou God þat vs soule ȝafVs lete hire so
                    ledeÞat seint Mihel hire mote a vongeAnd bi foren him lede A M E
                    N
BLAdd22283.Note:
Occurs separately. Two lines of verse for each line of
                    text.
BLAdd22283.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library MS Add. 22283 (‘Simeon’).
         2014; http://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?ref=Add_MS_22283.

BLAdd24542.First Lines:
…pit of helle is a midden erthe…of heuene…was of
                    gynne
BLAdd24542.Last Lines:
…and iwel in my…as eft I doin þis maner þe
                    here mowe of reyn & of snow
BLAdd24542.Note:
Occurs separately. Nineteenth-century copy. Parts of the text are
                    omitted throughout, with spaces left mid-line on many occasions. Text is
                    incomplete.
BLAdd24542.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             The Early South-English Legendary.
EETS
         o.s. 87 (1887; repr. 1987): 311-17, ll. 391-626.

BLAdd36983.First Lines:
Bothe for clerkys & for lewed menÞys englysch tale ys y
                    founde…
BLAdd36983.Last Lines:
…Þat seint myȝhell yt Reseyve moteAnd py fore hym
                    lede. Amen
BLAdd36983.Note:
Preceded by a unique Prologue of 24 lines; occurs
                    separately.

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: De riȝte putte of helle a midde erde is with Inneour lord þat al made iwis quinte is of gynne…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …& ous wite & hardi her fram deþlich synne& bring ous to þe ioie þat sein Michel is Inne
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum C” added to upper right margin by later hand (f. 276); ends “Amen” (f. 281).
BLCottJulDIX.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library  Cotton Julius MS D IX.
         https://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?ref=Cotton_MS_Julius_D_IX.

BLEge1993.First Lines: Þe riȝte piȝt of helle amidden erþe is wiþinneOure lord þat al made queinte he was of ginne…
BLEge1993.Last Lines: …Now god þat vs soule ȝaf lete vs here so redeþat seint Michel hire afonge & bifore him lede

BLEge2810.First Lines: …As þe blake clouden beþ & oþer wederes alsoIt nis vprȝt fram erþe bote an mile to…
BLEge2810.Last Lines: …nou god þat vs soul ȝaf us lete hire here to redeþat seint michel is mot auong & into heuene lede

BLEge2891.First Lines: Þe riȝte put of helle is amidde eorþe wiþ InneOure louerd þer al made iwis queintis of gyne…
BLEge2891.Last Lines: …Nou god þat us soule ȝof us lete here so redeþat sein Michel it mot auonge and biside him lede
BLEge2891.Note: With I and II; lines 1-4 missing. Ends “amen.”

BLHar874.First Lines:
[L]istneþ now lordynges and I wil ȝou telle Hou þe
                    werlde ymade was & whider out is helleÞe pure pytt of helle is
                    amyd þe erþe wiþinne…
BLHar874.Last Lines:
…And also men þat ben yborne vnder herpower Iwys Shullen
                    haue here diuers lijf after þat her vertu ys
BLHar874.Editions:
Horrall,  Sarah M. 
             “A Fragment of ‘St. Michael, Part III’ from the South
                English Legendary.” 
             Notes and Queries
         n.s. 30 [228] (1983): 302-3: 302-3.

BLHar2277.First Lines: ÞE riȝte put of helle is amidde þe vrþe wiþ inneOure louerd þat al makede iwis queynte is of ginne…
BLHar2277.Last Lines: …Nou god þat ous soule ȝaf ous lete hire her so redeþat Seint Michel ous mote afonge & tofore him lede

BLSto949.First Lines: þe ryȝt put of helle is amidde erþe wiþ innepure lord þat al made iwis quoynte he was & is of ginne…
BLSto949.Last Lines: …Nou god þat vs soul ȝaf us lets hire her so redeþat sent Michael here mote avenge & to þe ioyȝe of ihesu lede
BLSto949.Note:
Brown  and  Robbins (1943)
XCarleton Fairchild Brown,   and  Rossell Hope Robbins.  
             The Index of Middle English Verse.

CollArmsAr8.First Lines:
The riȝte pytt of helle is a mydde the erthe with ynneOure
                    lord it made there I wis that is so quente of gynne…
CollArmsAr8.Last Lines:
…Now god that to vs soule ȝaf so lete vs here so redethat
                    seint Michel hem mote affonges and bifore hym lede

NLS23711.First Lines:
The sede of man & woman clere as cristal it is
                    owre lorde hym selfe it made for man i wis…
NLS23711.Last Lines:
…Al bowyd is þe rygge so þat nyȝe rounde it is
                    man where of is pryde ther is none i wys
                    Sperma hominis
NLS23711.Note:
34 lines; same as lines 691-724 Cambridge UK,  Corpus Christi College 145 copy of 4732; occurs
                    separately.
NLS23711.Editions:
Holthausen,  Ferdinand. 
             “De spermate hominys.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         98 (1897): 401-3: 401.

HunHM64.First Lines:
THe right Pitte of helle is amydys the erthe witheinOwre lorde that
                    all made I wisse quenyte was of Gyn…
HunHM64.Last Lines:
…Now godde that vs sowle gave vs lete hire here so rede That
                    saynte mychall hit mote amonge & byfore hym leede

TokyoTak54.First Lines:
The riȝt putte of helle is amydde erþe wiþInneOur
                    lord þat it maad queynt was of gynne…
TokyoTak54.Last Lines:
…Now god þat vs saule ȝaf wel vs here redeÞat
                    seint Michael mote hem avonge and bifore hym lede. Amen.
